_header: Honoured be Thou blissful Lord above
Title(s): ‘The Song of Graces of All Saints’; Pèlerinage de l’âme
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, ‘The Song of Graces of All Saints’, in the English translation of the Pèlerinage de l’âme — four stanzas rhyme royal

Bod770.First Lines:
HEryed be þou blisful lord aboueþat vouched saue þis
                    iourne for to take…
Bod770.Last Lines:
…Had al refourmed lat vs syng & seyneHonoured be þou
                    Ihesu souereyne

OxfCCC237.First Lines:
Heryed be þowe blessyd lorde a boveThat vowchid sawfe þis
                    Iourney for to take…
OxfCCC237.Last Lines:
…Hadde all resownyd lette vs synge & seynHonowred be
                    þowe Ihesu souereyne

CamGon124.First Lines:
honowred be þu blysful lord aboveþat vowched saaf
                    þis iorne for to take…
CamGon124.Last Lines:
…had reformed let vs synge & seynhonowred be þow
                    Jhesu souereyne
CamGon124.Attributed Title: song of graces of alle holy seyntes vpon aster day (p. 243)

CULKk17.First Lines:
Honourid be þou blysful lord abo[ue]That vouchid saf þis
                    Journy for to take…
CULKk17.Last Lines:
…This may wel be clepid þe frut of he[ ]The frut of deth
                    was wher of [ ]assayed…
CULKk17.Note:
Missing letters transfer from facing page covers; lacks last 5 lines of
                    final stanza.
CULKk17.Attributed Title:
her endith þe drem of þe pilgrimage of þe soule (f.
                        124v)

BLAdd34193.First Lines:
Heriede be þou lorde aboueþou vouchede saue þis
                    iorneye for to take…
BLAdd34193.Last Lines:
…hade alle reformed lette hus singe and seynehonourede be
                    þou ihesu souereyne

BLAdd37049.Editions:
Doty,  Brant Lee,
                        ed.  
             “An Edition of British Museum MS Additional 37049: a Religious
                Miscellany.” 
         Diss. Michigan State, 1969: 422-4.

BLEge615.First Lines: HOnured be thu blisfull lord a boveThat vowchidsaffe this iourny to take…
BLEge615.Last Lines: …Hadde reformed therefore lat vs seyneHonured be thu Ihu souereyne
BLEge615.Note: Before last word of penultimate line, ‘synge,’ is written and then crossed through.
BLEge615.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             “Hoccleve’s Works: The Regement of Princes and fourteen minor
                poems.” 
             EETS
         e.s. 72 (1897); repr. 1988: 1.

NYPLSpenc19.First Lines:
Honoured be thow blesful lord aboueÞat fowchedest sauf this
                    iourney for to take…
NYPLSpenc19.Last Lines:
…hadde refourmed ther fore let vs synge and seynehonoured be
                    thow Ihesu souereyne
NYPLSpenc19.Attributed Title: The song of graces of alle holy seintes vpon ester day (f. 129)
